conclusion: Objects A and B are moving through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
Objects A and B come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F due to gravity, pushing the sheets or cloths down.
Object A will push the left cloth down, creating a shape that covers or partially covers objects C and D.
Object B will push the right cloth down, creating a shape that covers or partially covers objects E and F.
Both cloths (gray and orange checkered) will drape over the objects beneath them due to the force of gravity and the placement of A and B.
The left cloth will show the shapes and colors of objects C and D beneath it.
The right cloth will show the shapes and colors of objects E and F beneath it.
The cloths will be pushed down by objects A and B, creating shapes that cover objects C, D, E, and F.
The left cloth will cover C and D, while the right cloth will cover E and F.
This results in the sheets being draped over the objects as shown in the key step illustration.
The cloths will be pushed down, covering objects C, D, E, and F as illustrated.
